title: username module always shows `anonymous` on android devices
body:

  making the process a whole lot quicker üòä
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
-->

## Bug Report

#### Current Behavior
starship username module always returns `anonymous` on android devices

#### Expected Behavior
it returs correct username which looks something like like `u0_*`

#### Additional context/Screenshots
this is caused by the [switch to whoami crate](https://github.com/starship/starship/pull/6311) which currently [does not support android](https://github.com/ardaku/whoami?tab=readme-ov-file#supported-platforms)

#### Possible Solution
fallback to older implementation when target_os is android
```diff
diff --git a/src/modules/username.rs b/src/modules/username.rs
index 8ba3509..e3e1a83 100644
--- a/src/modules/username.rs
+++ b/src/modules/username.rs
@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ pub fn module<'a>(context: &'a Context) -> Option<Module<'a>> {
         .ok()
         .or_else(|| context.get_env(USERNAME_ENV_VAR))?;

-    #[cfg(test)]
+    #[cfg(any(test, target_os = "android"))]
     let mut username = context.get_env(USERNAME_ENV_VAR)?;

     let mut module = context.new_module("username");
```

#### Environment
- Starship version: 1.21.1
- Shell type: fish
- Shell version: 3.7.1
- Terminal emulator: [termux](https://github.com/termux/termux-app)
- Operating system: Android 14

#### Starship Configuration

```toml
[username]
format = ' [ÔÄá $user](bright-yellow)'
show_always = true
```
